alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 12:12PM EDT until May 06 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Johnson and Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1211 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Inez, Coal Run Village, Martin, Warfield, Allen, Endicott, McCombs, Pleasant, Gulnare, Corn Fork Hollow, Alvin, Odds, Emma, Moree, Davella and Ivel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
